author: Ethan Holesha
title: IL Attorney General urges residents be vigilant when seeking weight loss drugs
text:
WCIA Champaign IL Attorney General urges residents be vigilant when seeking weight loss drugs Ethan Holesha Thu, December 19, 2024 at 8:58 PM UTC 4 min read
CHICAGO, Ill. (WCIA) — Attorney General Kwame Raoul’s Office has issued cease and desist letters to five med spas in the Chicagoland area for misleading marketing of weight loss medications.
Raoul is warning Illinois residents seeking to purchase GLP-1 medications such as Ozempic, Wegovy, Mounjaro and Zepbound to be aware that many sellers advertising these name brand medications are instead offering unapproved versions of these products that might put people’s health at risk.
New IL pay stub requirement will begin in 2025
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement He is strongly urging people to obtain prescriptions for weight loss medications from a trusted health care provider and to fill those prescriptions at an appropriately licensed pharmacy.
Raoul is warning consumers of misleading advertising by med spas, wellness centers, online retailers and social media sellers that states or implies they are offering name brand GLP-1 medications or generic versions of name brand medications, when in reality they are offering compounded drugs.
These compounded drugs are not the same as generic drugs because they are not approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), as they are often produced on site and by prescription for individual patients who aren’t able to take a drug in its FDA-approved form.
However, when a drug is in short supply, the FDA allows certain larger pharmacies to use the active ingredient in that drug to produce compounded versions of the drug in order to meet the public demand. The FDA doesn’t review compounded drugs for safety, quality or effectiveness, however, and these drugs may pose health risks.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement “Millions of Americans are looking for help losing weight, and for reasons ranging from the costs to the availability of prescription drugs, they are looking for alternate means of buying what can be lifesaving medications,” Raoul said.
According to Raoul, unscrupulous sellers are also making misleading health claims and promoting GLP-1 products in formulations that haven’t been evaluated by regulatory agencies or tested in humans at all, such as drops, skin patches and nasal sprays.
IL community colleges join forces to feed needy during holidays
The FDA has issued warnings to try to stop the distribution of illegal versions of weight loss products. Some GLP-1 medications are being sold directly to consumers without prescriptions or are research-only products that should never be used by humans.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement More in Health Ozempic before and after: 5 women get real about weight loss, side effects and cost TODAY Dear Abby: All my decades-long friends have shunned me — I don’t know why NY Post USDA issues warning after ground beef shipment tests positive for potentially life-threatening bacteria — here's how you can stay safe The Cool Down A busy longevity clinic owner is 33 but says her biological age is 22. Here's the daily routine she follows. INSIDER The office said before purchasing products advertised as GLP-1 medications, consider the following questions. If the answer to any of them is yes, avoid purchasing the medication to protect yourself from serious health consequences that may be associated with compounded or fake products. Raoul is urging consumers to ask:
Does the seller offer GLP-1 medications without a prescription or without the supervision of a licensed health care provider?
Does the seller offer research-grade, research-only or GLP-1 medications for research purposes?
Are consumers encouraged to reconstitute GLP-1 medications, break apart Mounjaro and Zepbound pens or vials to use as separate doses, or to water down doses?
Is the GLP-1 medication mixed with other medications or chemicals?
Is the GLP-1 medication offered as drops, sprays, skin patches or in under-the-tongue form?
Is the seller promoting GLP-1 medication to consumers under the age of 18?
Is the GLP-1 medication sold without disclosing the potential side effects or safety risks?
Is the compounding pharmacy, med spa, wellness center or online retailer making claims about the GLP-1 medication’s safety and efficacy?
Is the seller offering to sell more than three months of GLP-1 medications at once?
Is the GLP-1 medication being sold or shipped from another country?
Is the GLP-1 medication sold by an individual person, including by someone on social media?
Are consumers being encouraged to lie to obtain the GLP-1 medication, including by misrepresenting their weight or BMI?
Raoul is urging consumers considering taking a GLP-1 medication for weight loss to first consult a trusted physician and fill any prescriptions at state-licensed pharmacies. To find out whether a medication shortage exists before taking that drug, check the FDA’s drug shortage database .
Firearm deer season harvests 82,000 deer across Illinois, up from last year
Knowing whether a medication shortage exists can be a sign that the drug you are contemplating is potentially being compounded. Ask questions about what exactly is being offered, including active and other ingredients.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Consumers should avoid obtaining or filling prescriptions from unknown sources. If filling prescriptions from an online pharmacy, visit the FDA’s online pharmacy information page for resources about safely obtaining prescription medicines online.
Raoul encourages Illinois residents to report deceptive marketing or the sale of unsafe products on the Attorney General’s website or by calling one of the Attorney General’s Consumer Fraud Hotlines:
800-386-5438 (Chicago)
800-243-0618 (Springfield)
800-243-0607 (Carbondale)
866-310-8398 (Spanish-language hotline)
Copyright 2024 Nexstar Media, Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
For the latest news, weather, sports, and streaming video, head to WCIA.com.

author: Nouvelles
title: Guerre de Trump contre la recherche : adieu à la liberté académique
text:
2024-11-15 11:10:00
Le coronavirus est une création de l’Institut de virologie de Wuhan, les éoliennes provoquent le cancer et le changement climatique est un canular au profit de la Chine – ce sont toutes les affirmations de Donald Trump. L’ancien et le nouveau président américain sont une figure centrale de la propagation de la désinformation. Depuis sa nouvelle victoire électorale, les virologues, climatologues et météorologues américains sont inquiets.
De nombreux scientifiques se demandent quelle sera la suite de leurs recherches. Parce que la lutte de Trump contre la science n’est pas seulement un danger pour les chercheurs et sa propre population, mais aussi un débat sur ce qui est vrai et ce qui ne l’est pas.
De nombreux scientifiques s’inquiétaient déjà lors de sa première présidence. Le léger espoir que Donald Trump modère sa position au pouvoir après sa victoire en 2016 s’est rapidement dissipé. Peu de temps après son élection, un projet de la Columbia Law School intitulé « Traqueur scientifique pour faire taire “, une sorte de base de données en ligne, a vu le jour. Le tracker était destiné à recueillir toute influence de l’administration Trump sur les opérations scientifiques. En quatre ans en tant que président, il y a eu 346 entrées de ce type.
Trump a par exemple réduit le financement de l’Agence de protection de l’environnement (EPA). Malaria-Medikament Hydroxychloroquine salué comme un remède miracle contre le Corona contre avis médical et en essaie un Supprimer une étude gouvernementale qui a révélé que les immigrants font beaucoup plus de bien que de mal à l’économie américaine.
Trump a porté atteinte à la science en tant que lieu Avec sa politique, Trump a causé des dommages durables aux États-Unis en tant que pôle scientifique. Par exemple, le nombre d’étudiants internationaux a diminué sous sa présidence. La délivrance de visas est devenue plus difficile et les États-Unis sont devenus moins attractifs pour les chercheurs hautement qualifiés. Des projets tels que le retrait de l’Accord de Paris sur le climat, annoncé par Trump six mois après son entrée en fonction en 2017, ont clairement montré à de nombreux scientifiques que la recherche était politisée.
Les conséquences dévastatrices de la politique anti-scientifique de Trump sont devenues évidentes après le déclenchement de la pandémie du coronavirus. Trump a créé quelque chose comme le virus de Schrödinger à partir du Sars-CoV-2. Trump affirme parfois avoir des preuves qui prouvent que le virus s’est échappé d’un laboratoire chinois, puis il a encore minimisé le danger que représente le Corona, affirmant que la maladie était totalement inoffensive dans « 99 pour cent des cas » et qu’il fallait simplement arrêter les tests pour éviter que la pandémie n’en finisse. .
Les conséquences de la politique de Trump ont été multiples : la violence contre les Asiatiques a fortement augmenté. Beaucoup, notamment dans le camp républicain, n’ont pas respecté les mesures de précaution ou ne se sont pas fait vacciner. D’ici la fin du premier mandat de Trump, rien qu’en janvier 2021, environ 400 000 personnes mourront du Covid-19 aux États-Unis.
Après leur défaite électorale en 2020, les États-Unis doivent désormais attendre encore quatre ans avec Trump à la tête de l’État. Des chercheurs comme Gregg Gonsalves, professeur d’épidémiologie aux universités de Yale et de Stanford, craignent de mauvaises conséquences pour la politique de santé. « Je n’aurais pas nécessairement choisi les personnes qu’il a nommées aux postes de santé lors de sa première présidence, mais c’étaient des personnes possédant une expertise. Cette fois, on dirait qu’il nomme des idéologues et des théoriciens du complot », dit-il au taz.
“Rendre l’Amérique à nouveau en bonne santé” Il s’agit par exemple de Robert F. Kennedy Jr., il sera probablement au centre de la politique de santé de Trump. Jusqu’en août, il s’est d’abord présenté comme candidat présidentiel sans parti, puis il a apporté son soutien à Trump.
« Rendre l’Amérique en bonne santé », a déclaré Kennedy comme son objectif et a formulé des images claires de l’ennemi dans son plan visant à « rendre les États-Unis à nouveau en bonne santé ». Cela inclut la Food and Drug Administration (FDA), qui, selon Kennedy, mène une « guerre contre la santé publique », en décourageant par exemple la consommation de lait cru parce que, selon Kennedy, il ne peut pas être breveté par l’industrie pharmaceutique. industrie. C’est pourquoi il veut fermer le département de nutrition.
Kennedy se considère comme un combattant contre ce qu’il décrit comme « l’orthodoxie » médicale. Il est contre l’establishment médical. Ce faisant, il discrédite la science en la considérant comme une institution qui suit des croyances fanatiques. Outre la FDA, il considère également des scientifiques comme Anthony Fauci, qui a conseillé Trump sur la pandémie du coronavirus, comme des ennemis. Et un sujet en particulier est un symbole de son combat pas comme les autres : les vaccins. Les vaccins contiennent du mercure et cela provoque l’autisme chez les enfants, affirme Kennedy. Il estime donc que vacciner les enfants est « faute professionnelle médicale criminelle « .
Pour lui, les vaccinations corona sont les « vaccinations les plus mortelles jamais créées ». Dans le cadre de la défense de la santé des enfants, Kennedy a soutenu les efforts des anti-vaccins dans la nation insulaire des Samoa, où deux jeunes enfants sont morts des suites d’une vaccination contre la rougeole en 2018 en raison d’une erreur de deux infirmières. Le taux de vaccination contre la rougeole s’est ensuite effondré : en 2019, il y a eu une épidémie parmi les enfants samoans avec un total de 83 décès.
Alors que Kennedy a nié vouloir interdire les vaccinations à tous les niveaux, il a déclaré qu’il souhaitait fournir la « meilleure information » sur les risques des vaccinations. Certains États à majorité républicaine montrent déjà à quoi cela pourrait ressembler. En Floride, environ Vaccins à ARNm contre Corona déconseillé aux personnes âgées. Cela remonte à une initiative de l’inspecteur sanitaire républicain de Floride, Joseph A. Ladapo, également envisagé pour ce rôle au niveau fédéral.
Une nouvelle marche pour la science La Floride est l’un des États où le nombre de cas et de décès dus au coronavirus est le plus élevé. Depuis 2022, même la lèpre est redevenue endémique dans l’État. Gregg Gonsalves, professeur à Yale, se souvient de l’époque du déni du sida en Afrique du Sud : « mais cette fois, il ne s’agit pas seulement du VIH, mais de l’ensemble du secteur de la santé. C’est terrifiant.
Trump a entraîné la science dans la guerre culturelle. Il s’agit de souveraineté d’interprétation
Trump pourra influencer la science principalement par le biais de la politique budgétaire et des décrets. Par exemple, en installant ses partisans à des postes clés au sein des autorités ou, comme annoncé, en supprimant le ministère de l’Éducation. Ce sont des points qui ont été décrits dans le « Projet 2025 », un pamphlet autoritaire-conservateur qui, entre autres Rénovation complète du paysage de la recherche et de la santé fournit.
Lors de son premier mandat, une résistance émerge rapidement dans les rangs de la recherche. La Marche pour la science a eu lieu le 22 avril 2017. Rien que dans la capitale Washington, D.C., 40 000 personnes y ont participé. “Nous devons nous unir contre cette politique”, explique encore Gonsalves. « Nous ne sommes pas impuissants. J’ai envoyé un message à mes collègues de l’ère Corona et leur ai demandé qui aimerait s’impliquer dans la défense de la santé publique. Dès les premiers jours, 700 personnes ont déjà répondu.»
Cela devient clair : la science est engagée dans une bataille défensive. Trump menace déjà de poursuivre d’éminents scientifiques du Covid comme Anthony Fauci et de licencier les chercheurs des agences s’ils s’opposent à lui. Trump a entraîné la science dans la guerre culturelle ; il s’agit de la souveraineté de l’interprétation.
#Guerre #Trump #contre #recherche #adieu #liberté #académique
1731662037

author: Joshua Clipperton; The Canadian Press
title: Devils down Maple Leafs 6-5; Matthews scores two to reach 68 goals on the season
text:
TORONTO — Jesper Bratt scored his second goal of the game with 1:14 left in regulation as the New Jersey Devils downed Toronto 6-5 on a night where Maple Leafs star Auston Matthews added two goals of his own to give him an NHL-topping 68 on the season Thursday.
Timo Meier, with two goals and an assist, Erik Haula and Nolan Foote provided the rest of the offence for New Jersey (38-37-5). Jake Allen stopped 27 shots. Luke Hughes had two assists. Bratt added an assist for a three-point performance.
John Tavares, with two, and David Kampf had the other goals for Toronto (46-24-9). Ilya Samsonov made 14 saves. Max Domi and Mitch Marner chipped in two assists each.
William Nylander played the 600th regular-season game of his career for the Leafs, who suffered an ugly 6-3 loss to the Devils on home ice late last month before picking up a 5-2 road victory Tuesday.
Looking to become the first player to reach 70 goals in more than three decades, Matthews' current total is the most in the NHL since Mario Lemieux's 69 in 1995-96.
Toronto is still looking to move up into second place in the Atlantic Division before the playoffs start April 20, while New Jersey is playing for pride and jobs next season.
Tied 4-4 through two periods, Matthews took a tripping penalty in the third and the Devils capitalized when Bratt beat Samsonov with this 26th at 11:03.
Tavares got things back level again with 4:47 left in regulation when he buried his second of the night — and 26th of the campaign — off a Morgan Rielly setup.
But the Devils responded with 74 seconds left on the clock when Bratt snapped his 27th off the rush.
The Leafs got a late power play for a 6-on-4 advantage, but couldn't find the range.
Down 3-2 after a wild and sloppy first, Matthews scored his second of the evening and 68th of the campaign off an inch-perfect Domi pass at 7:59 before chants of "M-V-P!" rained down from the Scotiabank Arena stands.
The goal — his ninth in the last seven games — was the sniper's 274th all-time at even strength to pass Mats Sundin for top spot in franchise history.
Kampf made a nice move to score his eighth just 1:17 later before Devils defenceman Simon Nemec got mixed up with Matthews. Domi took exception and dropped the gloves with the rookie to earn himself an instigator penalty and a 10-minute misconduct.
The Devils got back even with 11.6 seconds left in the period when Meier ripped his second of the night — and 27th overall — to knot things 4-4 through 40 minutes.
Tavares opened the scoring 18 seconds into the first when he swept home his 25th. Haula responded 21 seconds later with his 16th.
Matthews then snapped his 67th at 6:08 — the 366th of his career to pass Dave Keon for third on the franchise's all-time list.
Foote, who missed most of the season with an undisclosed injury, got that one back at 7:57 when he jumped on a Mark Giordano giveaway to score his first.
Toronto winger Nick Robertson had a goal overturned on a coach's challenge for offside a few minutes later.
The Devils got the game's first power play and converted when Meier scored his 26th at 12:37 for a 3-2 lead.
KNIES ON YOTES
Leafs rookie and Phoenix native Matthew Knies was asked before the game about the Arizona Coyotes potential move to Salt Lake City, Utah, as early as next season.
"Pretty unfortunate," the 21-year-old winger told reporters following Thursday's morning skate. "The Coyotes did a lot for me growing up, and I loved going to the games. It was a big reason as to why I got into hockey.
"I'm hopeful that they can stay."
EDDY RETURNS
Leafs defenceman Joel Edmundson was back in the lineup after missing the last eight games with an undisclosed injury.
Fellow blueliner Jake McCabe, meanwhile, got the night off with the team looking to get as healthy as possible for the playoffs.
UP NEXT
Toronto: Hosts the Detroit Red Wings on Saturday.
New Jersey: Visits the Philadelphia Flyers on Saturday.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published April 11, 2024.
___
Follow @JClipperton_CP on X.
Joshua Clipperton, The Canadian Press

author: Aleksha McLoughlin
title: A new split-screen feature is coming to Google Chrome, and it's surprisingly powerful
text:
Split the difference A Google Chrome Canary beta build has revealed a new split-screen feature
It's been updated twice and renamed since it was first discovered
It's not available to the public yet, but is expected to release soon
The latest beta build of Google Chrome features brand-new split-screen functionality. This feature lets you use two windows in a single tab and even dynamically change the size of the windows for enhanced productivity.
Uncovered by X user Leopeva64, the new Google Chrome split-screen feature appears to be now known as "Show side-by-side". However, it was first available in the drop-down menu as "Split tab with active tab".
Naming conventions aside, the functionality is identical between the two beta updates; you can merge two windows in the browser under one larger tab, and then you're able to resize the two sides, which means you won't have to manually drag two windows snapped together or swap tabs out.
While confirmed to not be fully functional yet, plans are in place for the handle (space between the tabs) to be resizable as well. With a larger dividing gap, you can better separate the two tabs or minimize the gap completely for a seamless encompassing…
Aleksha McLoughlin

author: Lauren Frayer
title: Top U.K. court defines women under equalities law as someone born biologically female
text:
Top U.K. court defines women under equalities law as someone born biologically female
On Wednesday, Britain's top court clarified the legal definition of a woman: Someone born biologically female. The ruling has implications for transgender rights.

author: @telemundoCHI
title: Tormenta invernal podría dejar hasta 1 pie de nieve en algunas partes de Illinois
text:
Un gran sistema de tormenta invernal que se desplazará por las llanuras centrales este fin de semana está preparado para dejar fuertes nevadas en partes del Medio Oeste hasta principios de la próxima semana, dijo el Servicio Meteorológico Nacional, con hasta un pie (30 centímetros) de nieve posible en Illinois.
La tormenta llega cuando un sistema clipper ya está preparado para dejar hasta dos pulgadas de nieve en partes del estado de las praderas el jueves.
Sin embargo, la gran tormenta de nieve del Medio Oeste que se dirige puede pasar completamente desapercibida en el área de Chicago.
“Estamos en el extremo norte de grandes cantidades de nieve en el centro y sur de Illinois”, dijo el jueves el meteorólogo de NBC 5 Kevin Jeanes.
Los modelos de pronóstico actuales muestran hasta seis a ocho pulgadas de nieve al sur de la I-74, dijo Jeanes. Más al sur, podrían caer de seis pulgadas a un pie (15 a 30 centímetros) de nieve el lunes por la tarde, dijo Jeanes, aunque la trayectoria de la tormenta podría cambiar hacia arriba.
“Esperaremos y veremos si su trayectoria se desplaza más al norte, pero no hay cambios en el pronóstico en este momento”, dijo Jeanes.
También se espera que el noroeste de Indiana vea nevadas con efecto lago el domingo por la noche y el lunes como parte de la tormenta, dijo Jeanes, aunque los totales aún están en el aire.
“Si bien actualmente parece que la nevada más intensa se dará en el valle del río Ohio, todavía hay mucha incertidumbre”, dijo el NWS del noroeste de Indiana.
We are continuing to monitor winter storm that will impact the Ohio River Valley on Sunday into Monday. The exact track of this storm remains uncertain, and thus confidence is lower in regards to snow amounts and the extent of the impacts. Stay tuned for forecast updates! pic.twitter.com/OK2ZzvC4FF
— NWS Northern Indiana (@NWSIWX) January 2, 2025 Pronóstico y cronograma de tormentas de nieve Los modelos de pronóstico muestran que se espera que la tormenta de nieve invernal comience a moverse por Nebraska, Kansas y Missouri durante la noche del sábado al domingo, y que la tormenta se desplace hacia Illinois temprano el domingo por la mañana.
Alrededor de las 4 p.m. del domingo, la nieve continuará en Illinois, así como en Indiana, Ohio y el este.
“La mayor parte, si no toda, de esta nieve debería quedarse al sur del área de Chicago”, dijo Jeanes.
En la parte sur de Illinois, podría caer hasta 30 centímetros de nieve cerca del corredor de la I-70, dijo Jeanes.
“Incluso alrededor de la I-74 y el sur, podrían caer entre 15 y 20 centímetros de nieve”, agregó Jeanes. “Estaremos muy atentos a esto si esta tormenta avanza más hacia el norte”.
‘Nieve intensa y generalizada, posible formación de hielo significativa’ Según el NWS, las áreas de las llanuras centrales y el valle del Mississippi, especialmente a lo largo y al norte de la Interestatal 70, podrían ver nevadas intensas, con una alta probabilidad de al menos 15 centímetros de nieve.
Más al sur, el NWS advirtió sobre “aguanieve y lluvia helada potencialmente significativas” que afectarán a Kansas y los Ozarks.
A winter storm is expected to begin impacting the Central Plains by Saturday night, with heavy snow and significant icing potential spreading eastward to the Mid-Atlantic by early next week. See our latest Key Messages below. ❄️ pic.twitter.com/habFiutQEO
— NWS Weather Prediction Center (@NWSWPC) January 2, 2025 Gran ráfaga de aire invernal Si bien la gran tormenta de nieve podría pasar por alto por completo el área de Chicago, el noreste de Illinois no podrá escapar de una ola de frío inminente, que durará semanas.
“El jueves puede ser el día más cálido en el área de Chicago durante al menos un par de semanas”, dijo Jeanes, con temperaturas máximas de alrededor de 30 grados.
La ráfaga de aire del Ártico traerá temperaturas en picada al área, con máximas de alrededor de 20 grados a partir del viernes. Se esperan incluso sensaciones térmicas más bajas, con temperaturas que se sentirán en los 10 grados o en un solo dígito.
“Vamos a estar atrapados en un patrón más frío”, dijo Zachary Yack, un meteorólogo del Servicio Meteorológico Nacional con sede en Chicago a NBC News. “Definitivamente se mantendrá hasta mediados y principios de la próxima semana”.
Para la próxima semana, casi todas las mañanas en el área de Chicago tendrán sensaciones térmicas por debajo de cero o de un solo dígito, dijo Jeanes. El pronóstico meteorológico de NBC 5 Storm Team y El Tiempo Primera Alerta mostraron temperaturas de 20 grados que durarán hasta el segundo fin de semana de enero.
“La corriente en chorro se centrará en la parte central y sur de los Estados Unidos”, dijo Yack. “No hay nada que la vaya a mover de nuevo”.

author: SoccerNews
title: Joao Pedro on the spot as Brighton thump Tottenham
text:
Tottenham’s Premier League revival was halted in emphatic fashion after two Joao Pedro penalties and a stunning strike from Pervis Estupinan helped injury-hit Brighton record a thumping 4-2 win.
Spurs arrived at the Amex Stadium seeking a fourth successive top-flight success to reclaim fourth spot from reigning champions Manchester City.
But the north London club were ripped apart as Pedro’s double and Estupinan’s thunderbolt added to Jack Hinshelwood’s opener.
Tottenham, who claimed late consolations through substitute Alejo Veliz and Ben Davies, could easily have lost by more as rampant Albion twice hit the woodwork and had a Facundo Buonanotte effort disallowed.
Richarlison struck a post for the visitors and was twice denied by the offside flag, while Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg also hit the woodwork.
Yet, on this evidence, Champions League qualification looks a distant dream for Ange Postecoglou’s side, who had registered just one point from 15 before their recent upturn in form. Victory lifts Roberto De Zerbi’s hosts above Newcastle into eighth.
Depleted Brighton were missing eight first-team players while their visitors also had a lengthy list of absentees.
One-time Arsenal forward Danny Welbeck should have opened the scoring for Albion inside six minutes when he was twice denied by goalkeeper Guglielmo Vicario, but the Seagulls deservedly edged ahead with 11 minutes on the clock.
Tottenham’s porous defence failed to halt Pedro’s mazy waltz across the 18-yard box and his offload was emphatically dispatched into the roof of the net by 18-year-old defender Hinshelwood.
Brazilian forward Pedro duly doubled the lead with a spot-kick awarded following VAR intervention.
Spurs thought they had escaped when Jan Paul van Hecke’s header from a Pascal Gross corner came back off the right post but replays showed Dejan Kulusevski pulled down Welbeck as he attempted to reach the rebound and Pedro coolly rolled home from 12 yards.
Stunned Spurs showed little response and were in danger of falling further behind. James Milner rattled the right post with a superb curling effort before Buonanotte’s clinical finish was flagged offside.
The away side almost gifted Brighton a third when Pedro was sent through by a calamitous back-pass from Pedro Porro, only to see his attempted dink pushed wide by Vicario.
Postecoglou would undoubtedly have been happy to reach the break only two behind, albeit his side’s predicament nearly improved as Richarlison swept against the outside of the left post in added time.
The Brazilian then put the ball in the net having already been ruled offside and then curled wide before again being denied by the flag of assistant referee Darren Cann.
Tottenham’s frustration was quickly compounded. Seagulls substitute Estupinan, making his first appearance since November 9 due to injury, did the damage, unleashing a thunderous, dipping effort into the top right corner from around 25 yards following Milner’s short corner.
Tormentor-in-chief Pedro rubbed salt into Spurs’ wounds 15 minutes from time by dispatching his second penalty after Evan Ferguson was brought down by Giovani Lo Celso.
Veliz’s first goal in English football, after Kulusevski and Son Heung-min capitalised on sloppy Seagulls defending, eased the embarrassment before Davies’ header from a Porro cross increased the anxiety among home fans.
But Brighton weathered a frantic nine minutes of added time, during which Hojbjerg hit the base of the right post, to claim the points.
Soccer News Like
- Be the first of your friends!

author: 小浪财讯
title: 稀有金属ETF（562800）跌1.35%，半日成交额1592.69万元|稀有金属_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，稀有金属ETF（562800）跌1.35%，报0.513元，成交额1592.69万元。稀有金属ETF（562800）重仓股方面， 盐湖股份 截止午盘跌0.85%， 北方稀土 跌2.10%， 洛阳钼业 跌1.15%， 华友钴业 跌0.69%， 赣锋锂业 跌0.45%， 天齐锂业 跌1.10%， 中国稀土 跌2.60%， 中矿资源 跌0.98%， 西部超导 跌2.25%， 厦门钨业 跌1.31%。
稀有金属ETF（562800）业绩比较基准为中证稀有金属主题指数收益率，管理人为嘉实基金管理有限公司，基金经理为田光远，成立（2021-09-15）以来回报为-47.98%，近一个月回报为2.73%。

author: Morgan Fogarty
title: Former NC Gov. Roy Cooper expected to announce US Senate run
text:
Former NC Gov. Roy Cooper expected to announce US Senate run
NORTH CAROLINA – Former North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper could soon kick off a campaign for the US Senate. Sources tell us an official announcement is expected soon. It would give Democrats their top senate recruit ahead of the mid-term election next year.
Cooper served as governor for eight years before he was forced out by term limits at the end of 2024.
Washington Democrats see North Carolina as a prime opportunity to flip a Republican seat after Senator Thom Tillis pulled out of running for a third term.

author: @ahmedbaig2001
title: Analyst Selects VeChain as Prime Choice for 2024, Predicts VET to Reach $1.14
text: - VeChain (VET) has recovered above the crucial $0.03 support level, displaying a bullish “golden cross” pattern on its two-day chart, indicating potential for upward momentum. - A previous golden cross in June 2020 led to a 3,062% increase in VET’s price, with analysis suggesting a similar trend could see VET reach $1.14 by October 2024. - Short-term predictions include resistance at $0.035, with subsequent targets at $0.038 and $0.04, while a fall below $0.03 could lead to a decline towards $0.024. VeChain, known for its enterprise-level blockchain solutions, is making waves in the crypto market with its recent price stabilization. The token VET is showing signs of a significant turnaround, catching the eye of analysts and investors alike. Golden Cross Signals VeChain’s Bullish Momentum - VeChain’s price has found solid ground above the $0.03 support level. - The appearance of a “golden cross” on the two-day chart points to potential bullish momentum. - This technical indicator has previously led to substantial gains for VET. Could VeChain Soar to $1.14 by 2024? - Crypto analyst AJ suggests a possible surge to $1.14 if patterns repeat. - Historically, VeChain saw over 3000% increase following a golden cross in 2020. - While history is not a predictor, the golden cross remains a positive sign for investors. Short-Term Targets and Resistance Levels - VET’s immediate resistance lies at $0.035, with further goals at $0.038 and $0.04. - Analyst Teshkid emphasizes the importance of the $0.03 support holding firm. - A drop below this level could see the price fall towards the $0.024 mark. VeChain’s recent performance and the technical patterns emerging on its charts present a beacon of hope for those bullish on the project. Despite the unpredictability of altcoins, the golden cross and recovery from recent lows could be setting the stage for a brighter 2024 for VET.
